section.title: Grades
section.p: General PCC Grading Guidelines are found at catalog.pcc.edu/handbook/g301-gradingguidelines.

paragraphs.title: Attendance/Participation
paragraphs.p: Each day of class that you attend is worth 0.25% of your grade, up to a maximum of 4%. This does not include holidays, inservice days, or days where the entire class period is devoted to an exam. Typically in a term this leaves at least one absence that would not have a direct effect on your grade. However missing class will hurt your chances for success on exams because you will not get the same attention that your classmates had.

paragraphs.title: Written Assignments
paragraphs.p: Selections of problems from the textbook will be assigned to be be written up formally. Each written assignment is worth 3% of your grade for a total of 27%. See for the details.

paragraphs.title: Late Homework
paragraphs.p: Written assignments that are received late may receive a zero. If I have already graded the stack of everyone else's papers, then I may not have time to go back and grade any more. You may try to turn in something late, and if I have not yet graded everyone else's, then I can grade yours.

paragraphs.title: Presentations
paragraphs.p: You will be assigned a partner (or two), and on Wednesday November 13, each group will give a roughly 20-minute presentation on some topic related to sequences and series. These presentations are worth 9% of your grade. See for the details.

paragraphs.title: Exams
paragraphs.p: Please refer to the for exam dates, and for details about what is covered on each exam. Exams 1, 2, and 3 are each worth 20% of your grade.
